content:
That sounds like a fantastic meal prep strategy! Quinoa and brown rice are both great bases for a meal, and roasting a variety of vegetables is a wonderful way to add flavor, texture, and nutrients to your dishes.

By prepping a batch of roasted veggies, you can use them in a variety of ways throughout the week, such as:

* Adding them to salads or bowls
* Using them as a topping for whole grain wraps or sandwiches
* Mixing them into stir-fries or sautés
* Adding them to soups or stews
* Even using them as a snack on their own!

It's great that you're finding meal prep to be a game-changer. Not only can it save time during the week, but it can also help you stick to your healthy eating goals and reduce food waste.

Roasting vegetables is also a wonderful way to bring out their natural sweetness and depth of flavor. Broccoli, sweet potatoes, and cauliflower are all great choices because they're nutritious, delicious, and versatile.

What's your favorite way to season your roasted vegetables? Do you have a go-to spice blend or sauce that you like to use?

Also, have you considered trying any new vegetables or ingredients in your meal prep? There are so many amazing options out there, and it's always fun to mix things up and try something new!
